AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.ten undocumented aliens: hidden in the tractor-trailer, discovered at the immigration checkpoint stop and testified against Ramon De La Cruz
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Zeba Williams: co-defendant with Ramon De La Cruz, whose counsel articulated reasons for needing more time to prepare for trial
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Ramon De La Cruz: defendant challenging the sufficiency of evidence on his convictions and arguing against the denial of his pretrial motions, accused of transporting aliens
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Raymond McMillon: made arguments regarding the Speedy Trial Act and the exclusion of delay periods related to his continuance motions
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Luis Pena: United States Border Patrol Agent who approached the driver-side door of the tractor-trailer and questioned Zeba Williams and Ramon De La Cruz
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Manuel Hernandez: United States Border Patrol Agent who prepared to have his canine perform a sniff of the tractor-trailer's exterior steps
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Aroxa: canine used by Manuel Hernandez for inspection that alerted to the presence of contraband
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Jorge Miguel Hernandez-Gomez: alien being transported, discovered hidden in the tractor-trailer's sleeper area and testified against Ramon De La Cruz
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.United States District Court: granted continuances and entered ends-of-justice findings, which were used to determine the exclusion of delay periods under the Speedy Trial Act
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Speedy Trial Act: governs the timing of trials and requires the United States District Court to enter ends-of-justice findings to support continuances
